item.title: Unix philosophy-esque approach to web tooling
item.description: [Ongoing: Suggestions welcome] Creating WebP images If you want to recursively create .webp versions of images in a folder (same name, saved in same location, different extension name), this script will do that #!/bin/bash while IFS= read -r -d '' file; do cwebp -q 90 "$file" -o "${file%.*}.webp" || true done < <(find ./ -type f \( -name "*.png" -o -name "*.jpg" \) -print0) Some notes: The cwebp binary from libwebp is required.
